DataElement.preferredName: Cohort Study One Enrollment Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response for questions to determine eligibility for clinical trial participation, as outlined in the study protocol, for patients registered in Cohort Study One.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Cohort Study One Enrollment Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Studies in which subsets of a defined population are identified. These groups may or may not be exposed to factors hypothesized to influence the probability of the occurrence of a particular disease or other outcome. Cohorts are defined populations which, as a whole, are followed in an attempt to determine distinguishing subgroup characteristics._The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object._The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Studies in which subsets of a defined population are identified. These groups may or may not be exposed to factors hypothesized to influence the probability of the occurrence of a particular disease or other outcome. Cohorts are defined populations which, as a whole, are followed in an attempt to determine distinguishing subgroup characteristics.:The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.:The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.

Concepts.definition: A research study that compares a particular outcome (such as lung cancer) in groups of individuals who are alike in many ways but differ by a certain characteristic (for example, female nurses who smoke compared with those who do not smoke).
The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.
The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.

Property.preferredDefinition: Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient is in cohort 1 (NS
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is in cohort 1 (NSCLC cohort), is the lesion to be irradiated in the bone, lung. Lymph nodes of the neck, adrenal gland or liver?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is in cohort 1 (NSCLC cohort), is the lesion to be irradiated in the bone, lung, lymph nodes of the neck, adrenal gland or liver?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is in cohort 1 (NSCLC cohort), is the lesion to be irradiated in the lung, lymph nodes, adrenal gland or liver?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is in cohort 1 (NSCLC/SCCHN/Bladder Cancer/cSCC cohort), is the lesion to be irradiated in the lung, lymph nodes, adrenal gland or liver?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is enrolled in Phase 2, Cohort 1 is disease PI-non-refractory, i.e., did not progress less than or equal to 60 days after the last PI therapy and had greater than or equal to 25% response while on therapy?
